displayName: Ensure ASC Default policy setting "Monitor Web Application Firewall" is not "Disabled"
rationale:
When this setting is enabled, it recommends that a web application firewall is provisioned on virtual machines wheneither of the following is true:
Instance-level public IP (ILPIP) is used and the inbound security rules for the associated network security group are configured to allow access to port 80/443.
Load-balanced IP is used and the associated load balancing and inbound network address translation (NAT) rules are configured to allow access to port 80/443.
recommended_action:
1. Navigate to Azure Policy
2. On Policy "Overview" blade, Click on Policy ASC Default
(Subscription:Subscription_ID)
3. On "ASC Default" blade, Click on Edit Assignments
4. In section PARAMETERS, Set Monitor Web Application Firewall to AuditIfNotExists or any
other available value than Disabled
5. Click Save
error_message: Web application firewall monitoring is disabled
ruleNames: Ensure ASC default policy setting 'Monitor Web Application Firewall' is not disabled
